newsArray.description: World Cup 2023: विराट को जहां रिकॉर्ड मशीन कहा जाता है, तो अगर कप्तान को रोहित रिकॉर्ड शर्मा कह दिया जाए, तो एक बार को गलत नहीं ही होगा
newsArray.content: भारतीय कप्तान रोहित शर्मा (Rohit Sharma) ने अफगानिस्तान के खिलाफ एकदिवसीय मैच में बुधवार को यहां विश्व कप में सबसे ज्यादा शतक लगाने के साथ कई रिकॉर्ड अपने नाम किए. रोहित ने 84 गेंद में 131 रन की पारी के दौरान 16 चौके और पांच छक्के जड़े। वह 26वें ओवर में राशिद खान की गेंद पर बोल्ड हुए. लेकिन आउट होने से पहले मानो रोहित के बल्ले से रिकॉर्डं की झड़ी निकल गई. एक से बड़ा एक रिकॉर्ड. और ऐसा रिकॉर्ड जिसे भावी पीढ़ी के बल्लेबाजों के लिए तोड़ पाना एक बहुत ही बड़ा चैलेंज होगा. कुल मिलाकर रोहित के बल्ले से पांच मेगा रिकॉर्ड निकले. चलिए बारी-बारी से जान लीजिए. रोहित ने विश्व कप का अपना सातवां शतक जड़कर मास्टर ब्लास्टर सचिन तेंदुलकर के रिकॉर्ड को तोड़ा. तेंदुलकर ने छह विश्व कप (1992 से 2011) में छह शतक लगाये थे तो वही रोहित का यह तीसरा (2015, 2019, 2023) एकदिवसीय विश्व कप है. रोहित ने विश्व कप में भारतीय बल्लेबाजों में सबसे तेज शतक बनाने के साथ अंतरराष्ट्रीय क्रिकेट में सबसे ज्यादा छक्के लगाने का रिकॉर्ड अपने नाम किया. रोहित ने 18वें ओवर में नबी के खिलाफ चौका और एक रन लेकर 63 गेंद में अपना शतक पूरा किया. विश्व कप में भारतीयों में सबसे कम गेंद में शतक लगाने का रिकॉर्ड इससे पहले कपिल देव के नाम था जिन्होंने 1983 में जिम्बाब्वे के खिलाफ 175 रन की ऐतिहासिक पारी के दौरान 72 गेंद में शतक जड़ा था. भारतीय कप्तान ने इस दौरान विश्व कप में सबसे तेज 1000 रन पूरे करने के रिकॉर्ड की बराबरी भी की. उन्होंने 19 पारियों में इस आंकड़े को छू कर डेविड वॉर्नर की बराबरी की. सचिन तेंदुलकर और एबी डिविलियर्स ने 20-20 पारियों में 1000 रन पूरे किये थे. इस सलामी बल्लेबाज ने नवीन उल हक पर चौका लगाकर 30 गेंद में अपना अर्धशतक पूरा किया और फिर 85 मीटर लंबा छक्का लगाकर अंतरराष्ट्रीय क्रिकेट में सबसे ज्यादा छक्के लगाने का रिकॉर्ड अपने नाम किया. इससे पहले यह रिकॉर्ड क्रिस गेल के नाम था जिन्होंने 483 मैच (टेस्ट, एकदिवसीय और टी20 अंतरराष्ट्रीय) में 553 छक्के लगाये हैं. रोहित ने 453वीं पारी में इस उपलब्धि को हासिल किया. रोहित एकदिवसीय मैचों सबसे ज्यादा शतक जड़ने वाले खिलाड़ियों की सूची में कुल मिलाकर सचिन तेंदुलकर (49) और विराट कोहली (47) के बाद तीसरे स्थान (31) पर आ गये. रोहित ने इस पारी से रिकी पोंटिंग (30) को पीछे छोड़ा. सलामी बल्लेबाज के तौर पर रोहित का यह 29वां शतक है. उन्होंने इस मामले में श्रीलंका के दिग्गज सनथ जयसूर्या (28) को पीछे छोड़ दिया. उनसे अधिक शतक सिर्फ तेंदुलकर (45) के नाम हैं. पढ़ें ,राजनीति,खेल समाचार, और की ताजा समाचार अब हिंदी में ( ) लाइव खबर देखें: फॉलो करे:

creator: Tanya Aldred
newsArray.description: Chathli insists club culture has changed after ‘dark period’New chair says role is ‘most exciting job in English cricket’The new chair of Yorkshire CCC, Harry Chathli, has said that he would be willing to talk to Azeem Rafiq if it meant helping the club to heal.Chathli, 58, was appointed chair after an extensive recruitment process, which was ratified by members’ vote at September’s extraordinary general meeting. newsArray.content: The new chair of Yorkshire CCC, Harry Chathli, has said that he would be willing to talk to Azeem Rafiq if it meant helping the club to heal. Chathli, 58, was appointed chair after an extensive recruitment process, which was ratified by members’ vote at September’s extraordinary general meeting. He succeeds the interim chair Baroness Tanni Grey-Thompson, who remains on the board as a non-executive director, and Lord Kamlesh Patel, who stepped down in March. Chathli, who became a non-executive director in June, will serve a three-year term. England’s Reece Topley making up for lost time at Cricket World Cup Read more “The club has been through a really difficult time and has to find a way of healing itself,” says Chathli, “and if that means talking to Azeem Rafiq then of course I will do that. “I would say that most of the hard work has already been done. My appointment has come on the back of some really good work by the board over the past 18 months – increased participation from all ethnicities, and in the pathway programme, and the culture of the club has changed dramatically over the last three years. “It is the most exciting job in English cricket to get into Yorkshire after it comes out of this dark period and tries to get back to the top.” Chathli was born in India and grew up in Mumbai (then Bombay), coming to the UK in 1980. He founded two successful communications agencies and is an experienced international capital markets expert – financial acumen that is much needed at Headingley. He is also a lifelong cricket fan, and a keen club player, describing himself to the Yorkshire Post as a “hit and hope” batter. His daughter Kira plays for Surrey, the South East Stars and the Oval Invincibles. He has a clear idea of where he wants the club to be in three years’ time. “If you want to create an elite pyramid then you need a broad pyramid to do that, and you have two hurdles to overcome: financial and inclusivity. The vision I want is for a club that is financially stable and socially and economically inclusive for everybody.” Yorkshire are in financial dire straits. The club owes the Graves Trust £14.9m – though the Trust has agreed to postpone a £500,000 payment due this month until next April. skip past newsletter promotion Sign up to The Spin Free weekly newsletter Subscribe to our cricket newsletter for our writers' thoughts on the biggest stories and a review of the week’s action Privacy Notice: Newsletters may contain info about charities, online ads, and content funded by outside parties. For more information see our Privacy Policy . We use Google reCaptcha to protect our website and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. after newsletter promotion Various proposals have been on the table since the start of year, including bids from Rajasthan Royals and Mike Ashley, and the club hope to have signed an agreement to stabilise the club finances by Christmas. In July, Yorkshire were handed a £400,000 fine – £300,000 of it suspended for two years – by the ECB’s Cricket Discipline Commission as a result of allegations of racism and discrimination at the club over a 17-year period. They were also deducted 48-points in the 2023 County Championship, finishing second from bottom. Chathli is unperturbed. “If you’re a lover of English cricket then you know everything there is to know about Yorkshire – some of the drama is second to none. Yorkshire have won the most number of championships and contributes a significant number of cricketers to England. A strong Yorkshire is a strong England.”

newsArray.title: Rohit urges India teammates to not worry about external factors ahead of Pakistan clash
newsArray.description: Rohit urges India teammates to not worry about external factors ahead of Pakistan clash
newsArray.content: Listen to Story Following a commanding eight-wicket win over Afghanistan, India captain Rohit Sharma urged his team to focus on "things we can control" ahead of the mega World Cup clash against archrival Pakistan on Wednesday. India romped home to their second successive win of the World Cup after captain Rohit Sharma's majestic 131-run knock set up their eight-wicket thrashing of Afghanistan on Wednesday. Rohit scored 131 off 84 balls, hitting five sixes and 16 fours, as India chased down a 273-run victory target with 15 overs to spare at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. "(It) was a good win for us, very important to get that momentum at the start of the tournament," Rohit said during the post-match presentation. "For us it is crucial that we don't worry about external factors and just look at things we can control. We just need to show up and do well," Rohit said while talking about India's clash against Pakistan on Saturday in Ahmedabad. "Things like what the pitch is like, what combo we can play is what we can control. What happens outside we won't be worried about it. It is just about focusing on what we can do as players and how we can perform," the India captain added. Rohit said that absorbing pressure was crucial in India's first World Cup game. After being reduced to 5/3, India defeated Australia by six wickets in the first match to establish their dominance. "We have got guys who can play fearless cricket with bat and guys who can absorb like the last game. It is about absorbing pressure and taking the right decision on the field," Rohit said. "There will be a spell from the opposition where you will have to absorb pressure. Leading up to the tournament, we had played such games. "We have got players with different skill sets in our team. They bring different attributes of the game to the team and it puts you in good positions as a team when you have that," he added.

newsArray.title: Jasprit Bumrah plays down hype around Pakistan clash after India hammer Afghanistan
newsArray.description: Jasprit Bumrah plays down hype around Pakistan clash after India hammer Afghanistan
newsArray.content: Following India's emphatic victory over Afghanistan in the 2023 World Cup, star pacer Jasprit Bumrah downplayed the hype surrounding the much-anticipated match against Pakistan. The Indian pace spearhead emphasized the importance of focusing on their own team's strengths and implementing their own game plan. In a post-match press conference, Bumrah remarked, "See, every team will have batsmen, every team will have bowlers. We also have batsmen; we also have bowlers. We're not preparing any special for any special team. Yes, we're looking at ourselves more than the others because we've realised that if we focus on our team, we focus on our strengths, everything else takes care of itself." The seasoned campaigner highlighted how the team's focus remains on leveraging their own strengths rather than obsessing over the opposition's tactics. Being in control of their performance and strategy was underlined as the prime focus. Afghanistan may not have started the World Cup in India on the right note, losing two in two, but head coach Jonathan Trott says the boys are geared up to put in good performances and bring joy to the quake-hit country. Afghanistan were outclassed by 8 wickets by Rohit Sharma's India in Delhi on October 11. Mustafa Barghouti, Member, Palestinian National Council, slammed Americans for taking a stand to dehumanize Palestinians and said he is against terror anywhere, but Palestinians' struggle for freedom is not terror. Captain Rohit Sharma, who scored a magnificent century, broke Sachin Tendulkar's record for most hundreds in World Cup history. As the Israel-Hamas war continues for the fifth day, the world is divided over war.

newsArray.title: Watch: Kohli asks Delhi crowd to not boo Naveen-ul-Haq in IND vs AFG clash
newsArray.description: Watch: Kohli asks Delhi crowd to not boo Naveen-ul-Haq in IND vs AFG clash
newsArray.content: Listen to Story Virat Kohli, one of the world's most celebrated cricketers, demonstrated his sportsmanship during the World Cup 2023 match between India and Afghanistan on October 11th at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi. The former Indian captain, known for his aggressive style on the field, made a surprising appeal to the home crowd, asking them not to boo Afghan pacer . The incident was a stark contrast to an earlier altercation between Kohli and Naveen during the IPL 2023 match between Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) and Lucknow Super Giants (LSG). The tension had escalated when the two players exchanged heated words while Naveen was at the crease. However, Kohli's recent gesture showed a different side of him, reflecting his maturity and respect for fellow players. Kohli, who has been nicknamed "The King" and "Captain Fearless" by his fans, is renowned for his dominant play and incredible captaincy. His appeal to the crowd showcased his leadership qualities, emphasizing the spirit of the game over personal grudges. Despite their past differences, Kohli stood up for Naveen, highlighting the importance of respect and sportsmanship in cricket. The World Cup match was a significant event, with India securing an eight-wicket victory over Afghanistan. Rohit Sharma, the current Indian captain, led the team to victory with an impressive century. However, it was Kohli's act of sportsmanship that stole the limelight, reminding everyone that cricket is as much about respect and fair play as it is about competition and victory. Born and raised in Delhi, Kohli has always been a crowd favourite at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. His appeal to the crowd not only diffused a potentially tense situation but also set an example for millions of his fans worldwide. This incident reaffirms why Kohli is not just considered a great player, but also a true ambassador of the sport.

newsArray.content: जारी World Cup 2023 में दिल्ली के अरुण जेटली स्टेडियम में बुधवार को भारत और अफगानिस्तान (India vs Afghanistan) के बीच खेले गए मुकाबले में भारत की जीत में रोहित शर्मा (Rohit Sharm) की बल्लेबाजी तो फैंस के बीच आकर्षण का विषय रही ही, तो वहीं पूर्व कप्तान विराट कोहली और अफगानी पेसर नवीन-उल-हक के आए विजुअल ने करोड़ों फैंस का ध्यान अपनी ओर खींचा. और तस्वीर सामने आई, तो यह पंडितों से लेकर आम फैंस के बीच चर्चा का विषय बन गई. अब यह तो आप जानते ही हैं कि इस साल हुए इंडियन प्रीमियर लीग में दोनों की कैसी तस्वीरें सामने आई थीं. कैसे दोनों की तस्वीरें करोड़ों फैंस के बीच चर्चा का विषय बन गई थीं, जिनके कारण इन दोनों सहित गौतम गंभीर को भी जुर्माना भरना पड़ा था. Naveen will have to listen chants of Virat Kohli for the rest of his cricket life, no matter where he plays. - Ravi Shastri मैच के दौरान दोनों की "दोस्ती की तस्वीर" देखने को मिली, यो यह फैंस को खुशनुमा एहसास करा गया. दोनों पिच पर एक दूसरे से बात करते और मुस्कुराते हुए दिखाई पड़े. लेकिन इस आई तस्वीर के बीच खरी-खरी बोलने वाले पूर्व ऑलराउंडर रवि शास्त्री ने भी कमेंट्री के दौरान एक बड़ी बात कह दी, जिसे एक फैंस ने लपककर ट्वीट किया. शास्त्री ने दरअसल कहा, "इस बात का कोई मतलब नहीं कि नवीन कहां और किस मैदान पर खेलते हैं, उन्हें शेष जीवन भर कोहली..कोहली सुनना पड़ेगा", वास्तव जब नवीन जब बॉलिंग करने के लिए आए, तो पूरा अरुण जेटली स्टेडियम कोहली..कोहली से गूंजायमान हो उठा. "दिन की समाप्ति पर नवीन कोहली पवेलियन वापस जाएंगे"..यह भी शास्त्री की बात है Ravi Shastri: at the end of the day Naveen is going back to Virat Kohli pavilion. इसके लिए कोई इनाम नहीं है Ravi Shastri said - "Naveen Ul Haq comes out to bat, the whole Stadium souting "Kohli, Kohli, Kohli", a wonder why, No prize for guessing". फैंस इस बात के लिए जमकर तरीफ कर रहे हैं “At the end of the day, naveen-ul-haq has to walk back into the virat kohli pavilion” Ravi shastri ji letting the people know. पढ़ें ,राजनीति,खेल समाचार, और की ताजा समाचार अब हिंदी में ( ) लाइव खबर देखें: फॉलो करे:

newsArray.title: India were not focused on NRR before Rohit's headstart in win vs Afghanistan: Bumrah
newsArray.description: India were not focused on NRR before Rohit's headstart in win vs Afghanistan: Bumrah
newsArray.content: Listen to Story Pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah denied that the net run rate was a factor in India's comprehensive eight-wicket win over Afghanistan in the World Cup 2023 group match in Delhi. India captain Rohit Sharma smashed 131 off 84 balls as the tournament hosts chased down a 273-run victory target in 35 overs on a good batting track at the Arun Jaitley Stadium on Wednesday. Although it may come to use later in the tournament, Bumrah denied that Rohit's blazing hundred was a deliberate ploy to increase their net run-rate in the World Cup group stage. The hosts are only the third team to win their first two games and they are sandwiched between New Zealand and Pakistan at the top of the standings. "Not at all. We are not looking at it from the beginning (of the tournament. (Besides) we did not know that Rohit would give us such a headstart," Bumrah told reporters. "I don't think we had any such conversation so early in the tournament. Really happy with the way the game went and we finished it off." Bumrah claimed figures of 4 for 39 to assist in limiting Afghanistan to 272 for 8. When asked how he would rate his performance, the 29-year-old said he had learned not to measure success by the number of wickets he claimed. "Look, I'm not result-oriented. Just because I've taken four wickets that doesn't mean I'm very, very happy or I've done something extraordinary," he said. "I just go with my preparation. I go with the processes that I feel is right. I try to read the wicked and try to find the best answers."

newsArray.content: भारतीय कप्तान रोहित शर्मा (Rohit Sharma) ने अफगानिस्तान के खिलाफ एकदिवसीय मैच में बुधवार को यहां विश्व कप में सबसे ज्यादा शतक लगाने के साथ कई रिकॉर्ड अपने नाम किए. रोहित ने 84 गेंद में 131 रन की पारी के दौरान 16 चौके और पांच छक्के जड़े। वह 26वें ओवर में राशिद खान की गेंद पर बोल्ड हुए. लेकिन आउट होने से पहले मानो रोहित के बल्ले से रिकॉर्डं की झड़ी निकल गई. एक से बड़ा एक रिकॉर्ड. और ऐसा रिकॉर्ड जिसे भावी पीढ़ी के बल्लेबाजों के लिए तोड़ पाना एक बहुत ही बड़ा चैलेंज होगा. कुल मिलाकर रोहित के बल्ले से पांच मेगा रिकॉर्ड निकले. चलिए बारी-बारी से जान लीजिए. रोहित ने विश्व कप का अपना सातवां शतक जड़कर मास्टर ब्लास्टर सचिन तेंदुलकर के रिकॉर्ड को तोड़ा. तेंदुलकर ने छह विश्व कप (1992 से 2011) में छह शतक लगाये थे तो वही रोहित का यह तीसरा (2015, 2019, 2023) एकदिवसीय विश्व कप है. रोहित ने विश्व कप में भारतीय बल्लेबाजों में सबसे तेज शतक बनाने के साथ अंतरराष्ट्रीय क्रिकेट में सबसे ज्यादा छक्के लगाने का रिकॉर्ड अपने नाम किया. रोहित ने 18वें ओवर में नबी के खिलाफ चौका और एक रन लेकर 63 गेंद में अपना शतक पूरा किया. विश्व कप में भारतीयों में सबसे कम गेंद में शतक लगाने का रिकॉर्ड इससे पहले कपिल देव के नाम था जिन्होंने 1983 में जिम्बाब्वे के खिलाफ 175 रन की ऐतिहासिक पारी के दौरान 72 गेंद में शतक जड़ा था. भारतीय कप्तान ने इस दौरान विश्व कप में सबसे तेज 1000 रन पूरे करने के रिकॉर्ड की बराबरी भी की. उन्होंने 19 पारियों में इस आंकड़े को छू कर डेविड वॉर्नर की बराबरी की. सचिन तेंदुलकर और एबी डिविलियर्स ने 20-20 पारियों में 1000 रन पूरे किये थे. इस सलामी बल्लेबाज ने नवीन उल हक पर चौका लगाकर 30 गेंद में अपना अर्धशतक पूरा किया और फिर 85 मीटर लंबा छक्का लगाकर अंतरराष्ट्रीय क्रिकेट में सबसे ज्यादा छक्के लगाने का रिकॉर्ड अपने नाम किया. इससे पहले यह रिकॉर्ड क्रिस गेल के नाम था जिन्होंने 483 मैच (टेस्ट, एकदिवसीय और टी20 अंतरराष्ट्रीय) में 553 छक्के लगाये हैं. रोहित ने 453वीं पारी में इस उपलब्धि को हासिल किया. रोहित एकदिवसीय मैचों सबसे ज्यादा शतक जड़ने वाले खिलाड़ियों की सूची में कुल मिलाकर सचिन तेंदुलकर (49) और विराट कोहली (47) के बाद तीसरे स्थान (31) पर आ गये. रोहित ने इस पारी से रिकी पोंटिंग (30) को पीछे छोड़ा. सलामी बल्लेबाज के तौर पर रोहित का यह 29वां शतक है. उन्होंने इस मामले में श्रीलंका के दिग्गज सनथ जयसूर्या (28) को पीछे छोड़ दिया. उनसे अधिक शतक सिर्फ तेंदुलकर (45) के नाम हैं. पढ़ें ,राजनीति,खेल समाचार, और की ताजा समाचार अब हिंदी में ( ) लाइव खबर देखें: फॉलो करे:

creator: Tanya Aldred
newsArray.description: Chathli insists club culture has changed after ‘dark period’New chair says role is ‘most exciting job in English cricket’The new chair of Yorkshire CCC, Harry Chathli, has said that he would be willing to talk to Azeem Rafiq if it meant helping the club to heal.Chathli, 58, was appointed chair after an extensive recruitment process, which was ratified by members’ vote at September’s extraordinary general meeting. newsArray.content: The new chair of Yorkshire CCC, Harry Chathli, has said that he would be willing to talk to Azeem Rafiq if it meant helping the club to heal. Chathli, 58, was appointed chair after an extensive recruitment process, which was ratified by members’ vote at September’s extraordinary general meeting. He succeeds the interim chair Baroness Tanni Grey-Thompson, who remains on the board as a non-executive director, and Lord Kamlesh Patel, who stepped down in March. Chathli, who became a non-executive director in June, will serve a three-year term. England’s Reece Topley making up for lost time at Cricket World Cup Read more “The club has been through a really difficult time and has to find a way of healing itself,” says Chathli, “and if that means talking to Azeem Rafiq then of course I will do that. “I would say that most of the hard work has already been done. My appointment has come on the back of some really good work by the board over the past 18 months – increased participation from all ethnicities, and in the pathway programme, and the culture of the club has changed dramatically over the last three years. “It is the most exciting job in English cricket to get into Yorkshire after it comes out of this dark period and tries to get back to the top.” Chathli was born in India and grew up in Mumbai (then Bombay), coming to the UK in 1980. He founded two successful communications agencies and is an experienced international capital markets expert – financial acumen that is much needed at Headingley. He is also a lifelong cricket fan, and a keen club player, describing himself to the Yorkshire Post as a “hit and hope” batter. His daughter Kira plays for Surrey, the South East Stars and the Oval Invincibles. He has a clear idea of where he wants the club to be in three years’ time. “If you want to create an elite pyramid then you need a broad pyramid to do that, and you have two hurdles to overcome: financial and inclusivity. The vision I want is for a club that is financially stable and socially and economically inclusive for everybody.” Yorkshire are in financial dire straits. The club owes the Graves Trust £14.9m – though the Trust has agreed to postpone a £500,000 payment due this month until next April. skip past newsletter promotion Sign up to The Spin Free weekly newsletter Subscribe to our cricket newsletter for our writers' thoughts on the biggest stories and a review of the week’s action Privacy Notice: Newsletters may contain info about charities, online ads, and content funded by outside parties. For more information see our Privacy Policy . We use Google reCaptcha to protect our website and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. after newsletter promotion Various proposals have been on the table since the start of year, including bids from Rajasthan Royals and Mike Ashley, and the club hope to have signed an agreement to stabilise the club finances by Christmas. In July, Yorkshire were handed a £400,000 fine – £300,000 of it suspended for two years – by the ECB’s Cricket Discipline Commission as a result of allegations of racism and discrimination at the club over a 17-year period. They were also deducted 48-points in the 2023 County Championship, finishing second from bottom. Chathli is unperturbed. “If you’re a lover of English cricket then you know everything there is to know about Yorkshire – some of the drama is second to none. Yorkshire have won the most number of championships and contributes a significant number of cricketers to England. A strong Yorkshire is a strong England.”

newsArray.title: Rohit urges India teammates to not worry about external factors ahead of Pakistan clash
newsArray.description: Rohit urges India teammates to not worry about external factors ahead of Pakistan clash
newsArray.content: Listen to Story Following a commanding eight-wicket win over Afghanistan, India captain Rohit Sharma urged his team to focus on "things we can control" ahead of the mega World Cup clash against archrival Pakistan on Wednesday. India romped home to their second successive win of the World Cup after captain Rohit Sharma's majestic 131-run knock set up their eight-wicket thrashing of Afghanistan on Wednesday. Rohit scored 131 off 84 balls, hitting five sixes and 16 fours, as India chased down a 273-run victory target with 15 overs to spare at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. "(It) was a good win for us, very important to get that momentum at the start of the tournament," Rohit said during the post-match presentation. "For us it is crucial that we don't worry about external factors and just look at things we can control. We just need to show up and do well," Rohit said while talking about India's clash against Pakistan on Saturday in Ahmedabad. "Things like what the pitch is like, what combo we can play is what we can control. What happens outside we won't be worried about it. It is just about focusing on what we can do as players and how we can perform," the India captain added. Rohit said that absorbing pressure was crucial in India's first World Cup game. After being reduced to 5/3, India defeated Australia by six wickets in the first match to establish their dominance. "We have got guys who can play fearless cricket with bat and guys who can absorb like the last game. It is about absorbing pressure and taking the right decision on the field," Rohit said. "There will be a spell from the opposition where you will have to absorb pressure. Leading up to the tournament, we had played such games. "We have got players with different skill sets in our team. They bring different attributes of the game to the team and it puts you in good positions as a team when you have that," he added.

newsArray.title: Jasprit Bumrah plays down hype around Pakistan clash after India hammer Afghanistan
newsArray.description: Jasprit Bumrah plays down hype around Pakistan clash after India hammer Afghanistan
newsArray.content: Following India's emphatic victory over Afghanistan in the 2023 World Cup, star pacer Jasprit Bumrah downplayed the hype surrounding the much-anticipated match against Pakistan. The Indian pace spearhead emphasized the importance of focusing on their own team's strengths and implementing their own game plan. In a post-match press conference, Bumrah remarked, "See, every team will have batsmen, every team will have bowlers. We also have batsmen; we also have bowlers. We're not preparing any special for any special team. Yes, we're looking at ourselves more than the others because we've realised that if we focus on our team, we focus on our strengths, everything else takes care of itself." The seasoned campaigner highlighted how the team's focus remains on leveraging their own strengths rather than obsessing over the opposition's tactics. Being in control of their performance and strategy was underlined as the prime focus. Afghanistan may not have started the World Cup in India on the right note, losing two in two, but head coach Jonathan Trott says the boys are geared up to put in good performances and bring joy to the quake-hit country. Afghanistan were outclassed by 8 wickets by Rohit Sharma's India in Delhi on October 11. Mustafa Barghouti, Member, Palestinian National Council, slammed Americans for taking a stand to dehumanize Palestinians and said he is against terror anywhere, but Palestinians' struggle for freedom is not terror. Captain Rohit Sharma, who scored a magnificent century, broke Sachin Tendulkar's record for most hundreds in World Cup history. As the Israel-Hamas war continues for the fifth day, the world is divided over war.

newsArray.title: Watch: Kohli asks Delhi crowd to not boo Naveen-ul-Haq in IND vs AFG clash
newsArray.description: Watch: Kohli asks Delhi crowd to not boo Naveen-ul-Haq in IND vs AFG clash
newsArray.content: Listen to Story Virat Kohli, one of the world's most celebrated cricketers, demonstrated his sportsmanship during the World Cup 2023 match between India and Afghanistan on October 11th at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi. The former Indian captain, known for his aggressive style on the field, made a surprising appeal to the home crowd, asking them not to boo Afghan pacer . The incident was a stark contrast to an earlier altercation between Kohli and Naveen during the IPL 2023 match between Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) and Lucknow Super Giants (LSG). The tension had escalated when the two players exchanged heated words while Naveen was at the crease. However, Kohli's recent gesture showed a different side of him, reflecting his maturity and respect for fellow players. Kohli, who has been nicknamed "The King" and "Captain Fearless" by his fans, is renowned for his dominant play and incredible captaincy. His appeal to the crowd showcased his leadership qualities, emphasizing the spirit of the game over personal grudges. Despite their past differences, Kohli stood up for Naveen, highlighting the importance of respect and sportsmanship in cricket. The World Cup match was a significant event, with India securing an eight-wicket victory over Afghanistan. Rohit Sharma, the current Indian captain, led the team to victory with an impressive century. However, it was Kohli's act of sportsmanship that stole the limelight, reminding everyone that cricket is as much about respect and fair play as it is about competition and victory. Born and raised in Delhi, Kohli has always been a crowd favourite at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. His appeal to the crowd not only diffused a potentially tense situation but also set an example for millions of his fans worldwide. This incident reaffirms why Kohli is not just considered a great player, but also a true ambassador of the sport.

newsArray.content: जारी World Cup 2023 में दिल्ली के अरुण जेटली स्टेडियम में बुधवार को भारत और अफगानिस्तान (India vs Afghanistan) के बीच खेले गए मुकाबले में भारत की जीत में रोहित शर्मा (Rohit Sharm) की बल्लेबाजी तो फैंस के बीच आकर्षण का विषय रही ही, तो वहीं पूर्व कप्तान विराट कोहली और अफगानी पेसर नवीन-उल-हक के आए विजुअल ने करोड़ों फैंस का ध्यान अपनी ओर खींचा. और तस्वीर सामने आई, तो यह पंडितों से लेकर आम फैंस के बीच चर्चा का विषय बन गई. अब यह तो आप जानते ही हैं कि इस साल हुए इंडियन प्रीमियर लीग में दोनों की कैसी तस्वीरें सामने आई थीं. कैसे दोनों की तस्वीरें करोड़ों फैंस के बीच चर्चा का विषय बन गई थीं, जिनके कारण इन दोनों सहित गौतम गंभीर को भी जुर्माना भरना पड़ा था. Naveen will have to listen chants of Virat Kohli for the rest of his cricket life, no matter where he plays. - Ravi Shastri मैच के दौरान दोनों की "दोस्ती की तस्वीर" देखने को मिली, यो यह फैंस को खुशनुमा एहसास करा गया. दोनों पिच पर एक दूसरे से बात करते और मुस्कुराते हुए दिखाई पड़े. लेकिन इस आई तस्वीर के बीच खरी-खरी बोलने वाले पूर्व ऑलराउंडर रवि शास्त्री ने भी कमेंट्री के दौरान एक बड़ी बात कह दी, जिसे एक फैंस ने लपककर ट्वीट किया. शास्त्री ने दरअसल कहा, "इस बात का कोई मतलब नहीं कि नवीन कहां और किस मैदान पर खेलते हैं, उन्हें शेष जीवन भर कोहली..कोहली सुनना पड़ेगा", वास्तव जब नवीन जब बॉलिंग करने के लिए आए, तो पूरा अरुण जेटली स्टेडियम कोहली..कोहली से गूंजायमान हो उठा. "दिन की समाप्ति पर नवीन कोहली पवेलियन वापस जाएंगे"..यह भी शास्त्री की बात है Ravi Shastri: at the end of the day Naveen is going back to Virat Kohli pavilion. इसके लिए कोई इनाम नहीं है Ravi Shastri said - "Naveen Ul Haq comes out to bat, the whole Stadium souting "Kohli, Kohli, Kohli", a wonder why, No prize for guessing". फैंस इस बात के लिए जमकर तरीफ कर रहे हैं “At the end of the day, naveen-ul-haq has to walk back into the virat kohli pavilion” Ravi shastri ji letting the people know. पढ़ें ,राजनीति,खेल समाचार, और की ताजा समाचार अब हिंदी में ( ) लाइव खबर देखें: फॉलो करे:

newsArray.title: India were not focused on NRR before Rohit's headstart in win vs Afghanistan: Bumrah
newsArray.description: India were not focused on NRR before Rohit's headstart in win vs Afghanistan: Bumrah
newsArray.content: Listen to Story Pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah denied that the net run rate was a factor in India's comprehensive eight-wicket win over Afghanistan in the World Cup 2023 group match in Delhi. India captain Rohit Sharma smashed 131 off 84 balls as the tournament hosts chased down a 273-run victory target in 35 overs on a good batting track at the Arun Jaitley Stadium on Wednesday. Although it may come to use later in the tournament, Bumrah denied that Rohit's blazing hundred was a deliberate ploy to increase their net run-rate in the World Cup group stage. The hosts are only the third team to win their first two games and they are sandwiched between New Zealand and Pakistan at the top of the standings. "Not at all. We are not looking at it from the beginning (of the tournament. (Besides) we did not know that Rohit would give us such a headstart," Bumrah told reporters. "I don't think we had any such conversation so early in the tournament. Really happy with the way the game went and we finished it off." Bumrah claimed figures of 4 for 39 to assist in limiting Afghanistan to 272 for 8. When asked how he would rate his performance, the 29-year-old said he had learned not to measure success by the number of wickets he claimed. "Look, I'm not result-oriented. Just because I've taken four wickets that doesn't mean I'm very, very happy or I've done something extraordinary," he said. "I just go with my preparation. I go with the processes that I feel is right. I try to read the wicked and try to find the best answers."

newsArray.content: भारतीय कप्तान रोहित शर्मा (Rohit Sharma) ने अफगानिस्तान के खिलाफ एकदिवसीय मैच में बुधवार को यहां विश्व कप में सबसे ज्यादा शतक लगाने के साथ कई रिकॉर्ड अपने नाम किए. रोहित ने 84 गेंद में 131 रन की पारी के दौरान 16 चौके और पांच छक्के जड़े। वह 26वें ओवर में राशिद खान की गेंद पर बोल्ड हुए. लेकिन आउट होने से पहले मानो रोहित के बल्ले से रिकॉर्डं की झड़ी निकल गई. एक से बड़ा एक रिकॉर्ड. और ऐसा रिकॉर्ड जिसे भावी पीढ़ी के बल्लेबाजों के लिए तोड़ पाना एक बहुत ही बड़ा चैलेंज होगा. कुल मिलाकर रोहित के बल्ले से पांच मेगा रिकॉर्ड निकले. चलिए बारी-बारी से जान लीजिए. रोहित ने विश्व कप का अपना सातवां शतक जड़कर मास्टर ब्लास्टर सचिन तेंदुलकर के रिकॉर्ड को तोड़ा. तेंदुलकर ने छह विश्व कप (1992 से 2011) में छह शतक लगाये थे तो वही रोहित का यह तीसरा (2015, 2019, 2023) एकदिवसीय विश्व कप है. रोहित ने विश्व कप में भारतीय बल्लेबाजों में सबसे तेज शतक बनाने के साथ अंतरराष्ट्रीय क्रिकेट में सबसे ज्यादा छक्के लगाने का रिकॉर्ड अपने नाम किया. रोहित ने 18वें ओवर में नबी के खिलाफ चौका और एक रन लेकर 63 गेंद में अपना शतक पूरा किया. विश्व कप में भारतीयों में सबसे कम गेंद में शतक लगाने का रिकॉर्ड इससे पहले कपिल देव के नाम था जिन्होंने 1983 में जिम्बाब्वे के खिलाफ 175 रन की ऐतिहासिक पारी के दौरान 72 गेंद में शतक जड़ा था. भारतीय कप्तान ने इस दौरान विश्व कप में सबसे तेज 1000 रन पूरे करने के रिकॉर्ड की बराबरी भी की. उन्होंने 19 पारियों में इस आंकड़े को छू कर डेविड वॉर्नर की बराबरी की. सचिन तेंदुलकर और एबी डिविलियर्स ने 20-20 पारियों में 1000 रन पूरे किये थे. इस सलामी बल्लेबाज ने नवीन उल हक पर चौका लगाकर 30 गेंद में अपना अर्धशतक पूरा किया और फिर 85 मीटर लंबा छक्का लगाकर अंतरराष्ट्रीय क्रिकेट में सबसे ज्यादा छक्के लगाने का रिकॉर्ड अपने नाम किया. इससे पहले यह रिकॉर्ड क्रिस गेल के नाम था जिन्होंने 483 मैच (टेस्ट, एकदिवसीय और टी20 अंतरराष्ट्रीय) में 553 छक्के लगाये हैं. रोहित ने 453वीं पारी में इस उपलब्धि को हासिल किया. रोहित एकदिवसीय मैचों सबसे ज्यादा शतक जड़ने वाले खिलाड़ियों की सूची में कुल मिलाकर सचिन तेंदुलकर (49) और विराट कोहली (47) के बाद तीसरे स्थान (31) पर आ गये. रोहित ने इस पारी से रिकी पोंटिंग (30) को पीछे छोड़ा. सलामी बल्लेबाज के तौर पर रोहित का यह 29वां शतक है. उन्होंने इस मामले में श्रीलंका के दिग्गज सनथ जयसूर्या (28) को पीछे छोड़ दिया. उनसे अधिक शतक सिर्फ तेंदुलकर (45) के नाम हैं. पढ़ें ,राजनीति,खेल समाचार, और की ताजा समाचार अब हिंदी में ( ) लाइव खबर देखें: फॉलो करे:

newsArray.title: Yorkshire chair Harry Chathli willing to talk to Azeem Rafiq to help club heal
creator: Tanya Aldred
newsArray.description: Chathli insists club culture has changed after ‘dark period’New chair says role is ‘most exciting job in English cricket’The new chair of Yorkshire CCC, Harry Chathli, has said that he would be willing to talk to Azeem Rafiq if it meant helping the club to heal.Chathli, 58, was appointed chair after an extensive recruitment process, which was ratified by members’ vote at September’s extraordinary general meeting. newsArray.content: The new chair of Yorkshire CCC, Harry Chathli, has said that he would be willing to talk to Azeem Rafiq if it meant helping the club to heal. Chathli, 58, was appointed chair after an extensive recruitment process, which was ratified by members’ vote at September’s extraordinary general meeting. He succeeds the interim chair Baroness Tanni Grey-Thompson, who remains on the board as a non-executive director, and Lord Kamlesh Patel, who stepped down in March. Chathli, who became a non-executive director in June, will serve a three-year term. England’s Reece Topley making up for lost time at Cricket World Cup Read more “The club has been through a really difficult time and has to find a way of healing itself,” says Chathli, “and if that means talking to Azeem Rafiq then of course I will do that. “I would say that most of the hard work has already been done. My appointment has come on the back of some really good work by the board over the past 18 months – increased participation from all ethnicities, and in the pathway programme, and the culture of the club has changed dramatically over the last three years. “It is the most exciting job in English cricket to get into Yorkshire after it comes out of this dark period and tries to get back to the top.” Chathli was born in India and grew up in Mumbai (then Bombay), coming to the UK in 1980. He founded two successful communications agencies and is an experienced international capital markets expert – financial acumen that is much needed at Headingley. He is also a lifelong cricket fan, and a keen club player, describing himself to the Yorkshire Post as a “hit and hope” batter. His daughter Kira plays for Surrey, the South East Stars and the Oval Invincibles. He has a clear idea of where he wants the club to be in three years’ time. “If you want to create an elite pyramid then you need a broad pyramid to do that, and you have two hurdles to overcome: financial and inclusivity. The vision I want is for a club that is financially stable and socially and economically inclusive for everybody.” Yorkshire are in financial dire straits. The club owes the Graves Trust £14.9m – though the Trust has agreed to postpone a £500,000 payment due this month until next April. skip past newsletter promotion Sign up to The Spin Free weekly newsletter Subscribe to our cricket newsletter for our writers' thoughts on the biggest stories and a review of the week’s action Privacy Notice: Newsletters may contain info about charities, online ads, and content funded by outside parties. For more information see our Privacy Policy . We use Google reCaptcha to protect our website and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply. after newsletter promotion Various proposals have been on the table since the start of year, including bids from Rajasthan Royals and Mike Ashley, and the club hope to have signed an agreement to stabilise the club finances by Christmas. In July, Yorkshire were handed a £400,000 fine – £300,000 of it suspended for two years – by the ECB’s Cricket Discipline Commission as a result of allegations of racism and discrimination at the club over a 17-year period. They were also deducted 48-points in the 2023 County Championship, finishing second from bottom. Chathli is unperturbed. “If you’re a lover of English cricket then you know everything there is to know about Yorkshire – some of the drama is second to none. Yorkshire have won the most number of championships and contributes a significant number of cricketers to England. A strong Yorkshire is a strong England.”

newsArray.title: Rohit urges India teammates to not worry about external factors ahead of Pakistan clash
newsArray.description: Rohit urges India teammates to not worry about external factors ahead of Pakistan clash
newsArray.content: Listen to Story Following a commanding eight-wicket win over Afghanistan, India captain Rohit Sharma urged his team to focus on "things we can control" ahead of the mega World Cup clash against archrival Pakistan on Wednesday. India romped home to their second successive win of the World Cup after captain Rohit Sharma's majestic 131-run knock set up their eight-wicket thrashing of Afghanistan on Wednesday. Rohit scored 131 off 84 balls, hitting five sixes and 16 fours, as India chased down a 273-run victory target with 15 overs to spare at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. "(It) was a good win for us, very important to get that momentum at the start of the tournament," Rohit said during the post-match presentation. "For us it is crucial that we don't worry about external factors and just look at things we can control. We just need to show up and do well," Rohit said while talking about India's clash against Pakistan on Saturday in Ahmedabad. "Things like what the pitch is like, what combo we can play is what we can control. What happens outside we won't be worried about it. It is just about focusing on what we can do as players and how we can perform," the India captain added. Rohit said that absorbing pressure was crucial in India's first World Cup game. After being reduced to 5/3, India defeated Australia by six wickets in the first match to establish their dominance. "We have got guys who can play fearless cricket with bat and guys who can absorb like the last game. It is about absorbing pressure and taking the right decision on the field," Rohit said. "There will be a spell from the opposition where you will have to absorb pressure. Leading up to the tournament, we had played such games. "We have got players with different skill sets in our team. They bring different attributes of the game to the team and it puts you in good positions as a team when you have that," he added.

newsArray.title: Jasprit Bumrah plays down hype around Pakistan clash after India hammer Afghanistan
newsArray.description: Jasprit Bumrah plays down hype around Pakistan clash after India hammer Afghanistan
newsArray.content: Following India's emphatic victory over Afghanistan in the 2023 World Cup, star pacer Jasprit Bumrah downplayed the hype surrounding the much-anticipated match against Pakistan. The Indian pace spearhead emphasized the importance of focusing on their own team's strengths and implementing their own game plan. In a post-match press conference, Bumrah remarked, "See, every team will have batsmen, every team will have bowlers. We also have batsmen; we also have bowlers. We're not preparing any special for any special team. Yes, we're looking at ourselves more than the others because we've realised that if we focus on our team, we focus on our strengths, everything else takes care of itself." The seasoned campaigner highlighted how the team's focus remains on leveraging their own strengths rather than obsessing over the opposition's tactics. Being in control of their performance and strategy was underlined as the prime focus. Afghanistan may not have started the World Cup in India on the right note, losing two in two, but head coach Jonathan Trott says the boys are geared up to put in good performances and bring joy to the quake-hit country. Afghanistan were outclassed by 8 wickets by Rohit Sharma's India in Delhi on October 11. Mustafa Barghouti, Member, Palestinian National Council, slammed Americans for taking a stand to dehumanize Palestinians and said he is against terror anywhere, but Palestinians' struggle for freedom is not terror. Captain Rohit Sharma, who scored a magnificent century, broke Sachin Tendulkar's record for most hundreds in World Cup history. As the Israel-Hamas war continues for the fifth day, the world is divided over war.

newsArray.title: Watch: Kohli asks Delhi crowd to not boo Naveen-ul-Haq in IND vs AFG clash
newsArray.description: Watch: Kohli asks Delhi crowd to not boo Naveen-ul-Haq in IND vs AFG clash
newsArray.content: Listen to Story Virat Kohli, one of the world's most celebrated cricketers, demonstrated his sportsmanship during the World Cup 2023 match between India and Afghanistan on October 11th at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi. The former Indian captain, known for his aggressive style on the field, made a surprising appeal to the home crowd, asking them not to boo Afghan pacer . The incident was a stark contrast to an earlier altercation between Kohli and Naveen during the IPL 2023 match between Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) and Lucknow Super Giants (LSG). The tension had escalated when the two players exchanged heated words while Naveen was at the crease. However, Kohli's recent gesture showed a different side of him, reflecting his maturity and respect for fellow players. Kohli, who has been nicknamed "The King" and "Captain Fearless" by his fans, is renowned for his dominant play and incredible captaincy. His appeal to the crowd showcased his leadership qualities, emphasizing the spirit of the game over personal grudges. Despite their past differences, Kohli stood up for Naveen, highlighting the importance of respect and sportsmanship in cricket. The World Cup match was a significant event, with India securing an eight-wicket victory over Afghanistan. Rohit Sharma, the current Indian captain, led the team to victory with an impressive century. However, it was Kohli's act of sportsmanship that stole the limelight, reminding everyone that cricket is as much about respect and fair play as it is about competition and victory. Born and raised in Delhi, Kohli has always been a crowd favourite at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. His appeal to the crowd not only diffused a potentially tense situation but also set an example for millions of his fans worldwide. This incident reaffirms why Kohli is not just considered a great player, but also a true ambassador of the sport.

newsArray.content: जारी World Cup 2023 में दिल्ली के अरुण जेटली स्टेडियम में बुधवार को भारत और अफगानिस्तान (India vs Afghanistan) के बीच खेले गए मुकाबले में भारत की जीत में रोहित शर्मा (Rohit Sharm) की बल्लेबाजी तो फैंस के बीच आकर्षण का विषय रही ही, तो वहीं पूर्व कप्तान विराट कोहली और अफगानी पेसर नवीन-उल-हक के आए विजुअल ने करोड़ों फैंस का ध्यान अपनी ओर खींचा. और तस्वीर सामने आई, तो यह पंडितों से लेकर आम फैंस के बीच चर्चा का विषय बन गई. अब यह तो आप जानते ही हैं कि इस साल हुए इंडियन प्रीमियर लीग में दोनों की कैसी तस्वीरें सामने आई थीं. कैसे दोनों की तस्वीरें करोड़ों फैंस के बीच चर्चा का विषय बन गई थीं, जिनके कारण इन दोनों सहित गौतम गंभीर को भी जुर्माना भरना पड़ा था. Naveen will have to listen chants of Virat Kohli for the rest of his cricket life, no matter where he plays. - Ravi Shastri मैच के दौरान दोनों की "दोस्ती की तस्वीर" देखने को मिली, यो यह फैंस को खुशनुमा एहसास करा गया. दोनों पिच पर एक दूसरे से बात करते और मुस्कुराते हुए दिखाई पड़े. लेकिन इस आई तस्वीर के बीच खरी-खरी बोलने वाले पूर्व ऑलराउंडर रवि शास्त्री ने भी कमेंट्री के दौरान एक बड़ी बात कह दी, जिसे एक फैंस ने लपककर ट्वीट किया. शास्त्री ने दरअसल कहा, "इस बात का कोई मतलब नहीं कि नवीन कहां और किस मैदान पर खेलते हैं, उन्हें शेष जीवन भर कोहली..कोहली सुनना पड़ेगा", वास्तव जब नवीन जब बॉलिंग करने के लिए आए, तो पूरा अरुण जेटली स्टेडियम कोहली..कोहली से गूंजायमान हो उठा. "दिन की समाप्ति पर नवीन कोहली पवेलियन वापस जाएंगे"..यह भी शास्त्री की बात है Ravi Shastri: at the end of the day Naveen is going back to Virat Kohli pavilion. इसके लिए कोई इनाम नहीं है Ravi Shastri said - "Naveen Ul Haq comes out to bat, the whole Stadium souting "Kohli, Kohli, Kohli", a wonder why, No prize for guessing". फैंस इस बात के लिए जमकर तरीफ कर रहे हैं “At the end of the day, naveen-ul-haq has to walk back into the virat kohli pavilion” Ravi shastri ji letting the people know. पढ़ें ,राजनीति,खेल समाचार, और की ताजा समाचार अब हिंदी में ( ) लाइव खबर देखें: फॉलो करे:

newsArray.title: India were not focused on NRR before Rohit's headstart in win vs Afghanistan: Bumrah
newsArray.description: India were not focused on NRR before Rohit's headstart in win vs Afghanistan: Bumrah
newsArray.content: Listen to Story Pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah denied that the net run rate was a factor in India's comprehensive eight-wicket win over Afghanistan in the World Cup 2023 group match in Delhi. India captain Rohit Sharma smashed 131 off 84 balls as the tournament hosts chased down a 273-run victory target in 35 overs on a good batting track at the Arun Jaitley Stadium on Wednesday. Although it may come to use later in the tournament, Bumrah denied that Rohit's blazing hundred was a deliberate ploy to increase their net run-rate in the World Cup group stage. The hosts are only the third team to win their first two games and they are sandwiched between New Zealand and Pakistan at the top of the standings. "Not at all. We are not looking at it from the beginning (of the tournament. (Besides) we did not know that Rohit would give us such a headstart," Bumrah told reporters. "I don't think we had any such conversation so early in the tournament. Really happy with the way the game went and we finished it off." Bumrah claimed figures of 4 for 39 to assist in limiting Afghanistan to 272 for 8. When asked how he would rate his performance, the 29-year-old said he had learned not to measure success by the number of wickets he claimed. "Look, I'm not result-oriented. Just because I've taken four wickets that doesn't mean I'm very, very happy or I've done something extraordinary," he said. "I just go with my preparation. I go with the processes that I feel is right. I try to read the wicked and try to find the best answers."
